node.title: Maria James's family calls for a priest's exhumation, if DNA testing doesn't offer answers
node.alt: An old photograph of Maria James in a blue dress by the water with her young son Adam.
node.description: At a fresh coronial inquest into the death of a Victorian woman, the coroner warns the family of Maria James they may not get the answers they hope for, however, the answers may be found in a laboratory.
node.content:
["Lawyers for the family of murder victim Maria James say the Victorian Coroner should consider exhuming the late Catholic priest, Father Anthony Bongiorno.", "In their final submission to the inquest into Ms James's\u00a0murder, they proposed an\u00a0exhumation, if certain DNA tests currently available\u00a0prove inconclusive.", "\"The coroner ought to order further testing and possible exhumation, before finalising any findings,\" counsel for the James family wrote.", "Maria James was stabbed to death in her Thornbury second-hand bookshop\u00a0in 1980.", "She'd learned a local priest, Fr Bongiorno, had been abusing her younger son, Adam, and she was set to confront him on the day she was murdered.", "However, while the coroner has warned the inquest may not give the James family the closure it is seeking, there are new avenues of inquiry.", "As well as the potential exhumation of Fr Bongiorno, Victoria Police has\u00a0confirmed it has found a woman who may be a crucial witness, after a tip-off passed to it by the ABC podcast Trace.", "
The molecule of life
", "Counsel for the James family wrote in its final submission that, if DNA testing involving hair came\u00a0to nothing, Fr Bongiorno should be exhumed.", "\"The existence of multiple, independent accounts of sightings of Fr Bongiorno on the date of the murder, closely proximate to the scene of the murder, and appearing to be significantly bloodied support a proposition that Fr Bongiorno is a realistic suspect in this case and should therefore be exhumed, if the hair sampling is unsuccessful.\"", "", "
Father Anthony Bongiorno was buried in an unmarked grave after his death in 2002.(ABC News)
", "Retired detective Ron Iddles \u2014 who worked on this case in its infancy and, then again, when he ran Victoria Police's cold case unit \u2014 said the idea of exhumation had\u00a0his\u00a0support.", "Mr Iddles was asked at the inquest about the forensic merit in testing the DNA of Fr Bongiorno against DNA found at the crime scene.", "\"It should be done if it can be done \u2026\u00a0the current state of the evidence puts [Fr Bongiorno] as a high suspect, I'd say, and the only way you could totally exclude him would be to compare his DNA.\"", "Fr Bongiorno died in 2002, and his body lies in an unmarked grave south-east of Melbourne.", "", "
Ron Iddles in front of St Mary's in Thornbury, where the James brothers spent a lot of time as kids.(ABC RN: Jeremy Story Carter)
", "Exhumation would be a last resort, according to Flinders University forensic scientist\u00a0Adrian Linacre.", "\"I think there's a great reluctance to do anything like an exhumation,\" Professor Linacre\u00a0said.", "Exhuming the priest's remains would allow his DNA to be compared against biological traces found on Maria James' pillows and bed quilt.", "Biologists have found what's called partial, mixed DNA profiles \u2014 that is, some DNA from Maria James, some from an unknown person.", "These profiles have already been compared to four persons of interest: former real estate agent, Peter Macevski (the only living person of interest), convicted killer Peter Keogh, Mario Falcucci and Lyle Perkins.", "Results suggested it was\u00a0unlikely the DNA at the crime scene was theirs.", "However, comparative tests are yet to be conducted on the remaining two persons of interest: Fr Bongiorno and Fr Thomas O'Keeffe.", "However, before the weighty option of exhumation is considered, there is a less-invasive DNA test that could be done.", "
Mitochondrial DNA testing
", "Counsel for the James family has also submitted that a DNA profiling technique using mitochondrial DNA can be done using hair found at the crime scene.", "\"Hartman [Dadna Hartman, molecular biologist at the Victorian Institute of Forensic Medicine] recommends to the coroner that the three\u00a0hairs not yet tested, be submitted for mitochondrial DNA testing and, therefore, used for comparisons to include or exclude persons of interest.", "\"Bradley [Kathryn Bradley, forensic biologist at the Victoria Police Forensic Services Centre] concedes that it's possible that the hair sample is from the offender.\"", "With mitochondrial DNA testing, instead of needing direct DNA from the priests themselves, samples from their siblings can instead be used.", "Victoria Police could use a sample it covertly took from Fr Bongiorno's sister in 2014 and a sample from Fr O'Keeffe's twin-brother, provided by the ABC's Trace podcast in 2018.", "", "
Professor Adrian Linacre says\u00a0mitochondria can often still be extracted from older samples.(ABC News:\u00a0Rachael Brown)
", "Professor Linacre said this technique was great for testing really old samples, because there's lots of mitochondrial DNA in any cell.", "\"We've looked at hair that is hundreds of years old \u2026 when cells break down and bacteria munch away, you'll still often get mitochondria present.\"", "
Holding pattern
", "The two sons of Maria James, Mark and Adam, are waiting on tenterhooks for any DNA testing that can be done.", "They were hoping the coroner's finding would end their 41-year holding pattern. That finding could be delivered any time over the\u00a0coming months.", "", "
Maria James was murdered at her Thornbury bookshop in 1980.(Supplied)
", "However, after the inquest's 17 days, more than\u00a085 hours\u00a0and 34 witnesses, the James bothers aren't holding their breath.", "Especially considering the closing comments of coroner Caitlin English, who telegraphed that she might not be able to name Ms James's killer", "\"I may well not be able to reach conclusive findings \u2026 there won't be necessarily peace for you or justice for Maria,\" she said.", "", "
Maria James's sons, Adam (centre) and Mark (right), outside the\u00a0inquest into her unsolved murder.(AAP Image/James Ross)
", "An inquest for any cold case this old is a daunting task.\u00a0Witnesses die and memories fade. And an added headache, in this case, is that crucial police exhibits have gone missing.", "However, this might be a case that's not solved in the witness box, but rather in a science laboratory, or by a member of the public finally presenting with the missing puzzle piece.", "
Potential witness
", "A name of a witness who just might hold this puzzle piece has been provided to the ABC's Trace podcast team.", "For the past six years, the podcast team has been trying to track down an Italian woman, thought to have been working at St Mary's presbytery on the day of Maria James's murder.", "Allan Hircoe, an electrician who has said he saw Fr Bongiorno covered in blood, thinks this Italian woman might have seen the same thing.", "He told Trace he heard her screaming at the priest.", "\"I heard this muffled scream, from a woman,\" he said.", "\"I didn't hear him at all, but it was a woman's voice and she was completely distressed and screaming, and I thought, 'Boy, fancy getting that much in trouble for getting a bit of blood on your shirt'.\"", "Earlier this year, after Trace made a final push for leads ahead of the fresh inquest, a few people reached out with the name of a woman\u00a0who, they thought, used to work at the presbytery.", "They said the woman packed up her family and moved to Italy in the months after the murder.", "The ABC has passed this name on to Victoria Police and, during the inquest, cold case detective\u00a0Leigh Prados, was asked about his progress by one of the James family's lawyers, Chris Winneke QC.", "Mark James said the development\u00a0was\u00a0the first hopeful lead in a long time.", "\"The detective told me that he was able to confirm through people that are in Melbourne, that the actual presbytery woman is the woman we think it is, and she's overseas, and that he'll be moving the matter forward.\""]
